soot.jimple.infoflow.android.axml

Class AXmlElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.android.axml.AXmlElement
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AXmlAttribute, AXmlNode

    public abstract class AXmlElement
extends Object
    Basic class for all classes which represent elements from an Android XML file. Provides functionality to either include or exclude the element from the XML.
    Author:
    Stefan Haas, Mario Schlipf

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean added
      The added flag determines wheter this element was part of a parsed xml file or added afterwards.
      protected boolean include
      The include flag determines whether this element will be written out in the document.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AXmlElement(String ns, boolean added)
      Constructor for a new Android XML Element.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void exclude()
      Sets the include flag to false so that the manifest will not contain information about this element.
      String getNamespace()
      Returns the namespace of this element.
      void include()
      Sets the include flag to true so that the manifest will contain information about this element.
      protected void include(boolean include)
      Sets the include flag to the passed boolean value.
      boolean isAdded()
      Returns wheter this element was part of a parsed xml file or added afterwards.
      boolean isIncluded()
      Returns the current value of the include flag.
      void setAdded(boolean added)
      The added flag determines wheter this element was part of a parsed xml file or added afterwards.
      void setNamespace(String ns)
      Sets the namespace of this element.

      • isAdded

        public boolean isAdded()

        Returns:

      • isIncluded

        public boolean isIncluded()
        Returns the current value of the include flag. If true the manifest will contain information about this element.
        Returns:
        whether or not the element will be included in the manifest

      • include

        public void include()
        Sets the include flag to true so that the manifest will contain information about this element.

      • exclude

        public void exclude()
        Sets the include flag to false so that the manifest will not contain information about this element.

      • include

        protected void include(boolean include)
        Sets the include flag to the passed boolean value. If given true this element will be included in the manifest.
        Parameters:
        included - value for the include flag
